text:
When using mod_cache in front of mod_passenger (http://www.modrails.com/), if a request is made for a URL which exists in the cache, but which has expired, then a conditional GET request is made via mod_passenger to the rails application. If rails responds with a HTTP 304 status code, then passenger emits the following error:

"Apache stopped forwarding the backend's response, even though the HTTP client did not close the connection. Is this an Apache bug?"

mod_cache continues, and serves the cached content correctly, so there is no user-visible impact, but the error message is worrying.

Is anyone able to ascertain whether this is a bug in passenger, or in mod_cache, or something else?
creator: chrismay50@gmail.com
wrowe@apache.org
text: Yes, it appears to be a badly formed response or a bug in mod_passenger.
